Package eecs1021.lab5

Class StringUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • eecs1021.lab5.StringUtility
  • public class StringUtility
extends java.lang.Object
    In this lab you will practice writing methods, using classes from the Java Standard Library, and working with arrays and Strings. This StringUtility class will help you do things with string object. This StringUtility class contains a random assortment of methods that should improve your programming skills in using Java Control Structures (selection structures, repetition structures, and nested Loops), String. Hint: You may use java.util.Arrays class.

    • Method Detail

      • digitCountinString

        public static int digitCountinString​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a String str as input argument and returns number of digits in the given input String. Digits is any integer between 0 and 9.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and has length equal of 1 (at least 1 one character).

        For example: 

          if str = "mystring123"  then return 3
  if str = "123mystring123" then return 6
  if str = "123my25str047ing123" then return 11
        You will need a loop, and your loop must not execute more iterations than necessary, and you cannot use break or continue.
        Parameters:
        str - : input string
        Returns:
        number of digits in the given input String

      • removeDuplicatesChar

        public static java.lang.String removeDuplicatesChar​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a String str as input argument and returns string after removing all duplicates characters from the input string.

        The order of characters in the returned string is not important, so the strings "ECSLAB" and "CELABS" are same.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and contains at least 2 two characters.

        For example: 

         if str = "EECCCCCSSSLLLLLAB"  then return "ABCELS"
 if str = "0001110001001" then return "01"
 if str = "cvvvvaaabcca" then return "abcv"
 if str = "LabTtttEeeeSsssT" then return "ELSTabest"
        Parameters:
        str - : input string
        Returns:
        string after removing all duplicates characters from the input string

      • sumofDigitinString

        public static int sumofDigitinString​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a String str as input argument and returns sum of digits in the given input String. Digits is any integer between 0 and 9.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and contains at least 1 one character.

        For example: 

                if str = "123abcd45"  then return 15
        if str = "abcd1234" then return 10
        if str = "159825ABC" then return 30
        if str = "10125ABC" then return 9
        Parameters:
        str - : input string
        Returns:
        returns sum of digits in the given input String

      • lengthofMaxConsecutiveZeros

        public static int lengthofMaxConsecutiveZeros​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a binary String str as input argument and returns the length of maximum consecutive 0’s in a given input binary string.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and contains at least 1 one character.

        For example: 

                if str = "11101110001"  then return 3
        if str = "10000001001" then return 6
        if str = "0000100111" then return 4
        if str = "01001010100111" then return 2
        Parameters:
        str - : input binary string
        Returns:
        returns the length of maximum consecutive 0’s in a given input binary string.

      • removeConsecutiveDuplicates

        public static java.lang.String removeConsecutiveDuplicates​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a String str as input argument and returns string after removing all consecutive duplicates characters from the input string. The order of characters in the returned string is important, so the strings "ECSLAB" and "CELABS" are different.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and contains at least 2 two characters.

        For example: 

                if str = "EECCCCCSSSLLLLLAB"  then return "ECSLAB"
        if str = "0001110001001" then return "010101"
        if str = "cvvvvaaabcca" then return "cvabca"
        if str = "LabTtttEeeeSsssT" then return "LabTtEeSsT"
        Parameters:
        str - : input String
        Returns:
        string after removing all consecutive duplicates characters from the input string.

      • whitespaceCountinString

        public static int whitespaceCountinString​(java.lang.String str)
        Implement the method below that takes a String str as input argument and returns number of whitespaces in the given input String. whitespaces can be spaces or tabs.

        You can assume that the input String is not null and contains at least 1 one character.

        For example: 

           if str = "I am EECS1022 Student" then return 3
   if str = "I am EECS 1022 Student" then return 4
   if str = " I am E E C S 1 0 2 2 Student" then return 11
        You will need a loop, and your loop must not execute more iterations than necessary, and you cannot use break or continue. Make sure the method compiles without errors and returns the correct result when invoked.
        Parameters:
        str - input string
        Returns:
        number of whitespaces in the given input String.

      • compressString

        public static java.lang.String compressString​(java.lang.String inputStr)

        Write a compressString method that compression long String str that contain many adjacent equal characters (but no digits).

        For example: 

          
  compressString("")  return "" , empty string 
  compressString("bbbcfreb$b") return  "b3c1f1r1e1b1$1b1"
  compressString("bbbrrraaaaaazzzz") return  "b3r3a6z4"
        Parameters:
        inputStr - : string to be compressed, str is not null
        Returns:
        the compressed version of long string as explained above
        Precondition:
        Precondition: s does not contain a digit in '0'.. '9'.
